intro: Petrophile anceps, commonly known as the narrow-leafed rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Its narrow leaves and compact growth habit make it well adapted to its arid and nutrient-poor environment. Petrophile anceps is an important component of the native flora in regions where it is found.
